  • A1.9

    #Number Theory
    2001

    (i) Describe Euclid's algorithm.

    Find, in the RSA algorithm, the deciphering key corresponding to the enciphering key 7,527 .

    (ii) Explain what is meant by a primitive root modulo an odd prime ppp.

    Show that, if ggg is a primitive root modulo ppp, then all primitive roots modulo ppp are given by gmg^{m}gm, where 1⩽m<p1 \leqslant m<p1⩽m<p and (m,p−1)=1(m, p-1)=1(m,p−1)=1.

    Verify, by Euler's criterion, that 3 is a primitive root modulo 17 . Hence find all primitive roots modulo 17 .
